resources.string: A cozy, beautiful bistro on a quiet street in the heart of the city.

"Delightful settlement, Fusion cuisine and World–class cocktails – tree main ingredients for a breathtaking skyline over Bucharest.

"
"Upstairs, a chic all year rooftop bar located where East meets West, where Thai, French, US and international influences can be " "experienced in a stylish melange of cultures, events and goodies, is now opened in order to offer you a lifetime experience. " "Words are hard to describe the amazing view over the \„Little Paris\”, the electric and dramatic roofbar interior or the glamour " "and stylish nightview, so that is why we are waiting for you at anytime.

"
"Let\’s have a new beginning, together!

"

"Those who walk into the restaurant do the first steps on a memorable journey. At \“the Artist\” " "culinary experience is the transformation into an experience of emotions. Each dish is designed " "to reach all sensory chords. Here you will experience the amazing taste of something truly new, " "innovative and delicious.

"
"To offer new emotions and unique experiences, every season Chef Paul creates a new collection " "of delicious masterpieces, to the delight of loyal guests. Each menu is left to the imagination " "and artistry of blending the highest quality ingredients prepared with more creative and " "surprising presentation using cooking methods that optimize flavor.

"
"With an elegant ambiance in an establishment where modern design blends in with the historical " "elements of the property well preserved to enrich its personality, Restaurant \“the Artist\” " "creates a perfect setting for a unique experience for romance, friends or business. Here your " "imagination will be challenged and known gastronomic limits will be demolished. Are you " "ready for a unique experience?

"

"What is the Casa Bia for connoisseurs?

"
"An oasis of relaxation to escape from the daily, a secluded and discreet place, ideal for a " "lunch or business dinner, for an evening with family or friends. With a rich experience in " "culinary art, the chefs here perfectly know the true science of Romanian cuisine, combining " "the unmistakable taste with tradition but also the international one, inviting you to a " "gourmet travel around the world.

"
"Prepared with fresh ingredients, full of flavor and passion, delicious snacks, salads, " "soups, pasta, seafood, menus of chicken, sheep, calf, pig or fish, and spectacular desserts " "come to you to immerse your tastes, in a relaxing atmosphere, wanting you to always come " "back here. Passion, enthusiasm, unique decoration that blends the past with the present, " "services that excel through quality.

"
"Casa Bia.

"
"A place reserved for you.

"

"When music and technology meet, something groundbreaking is ought to happen \• TIMESHIFT " "Bucharest Music Festival – Step into another dimension! " "Between 20–23 of July enjoy the full festival experience at Romexpo OPEN AIR.

"
"DJ SNAKE is headlining on the 1st day (Thursday July 20th) of TIMESHIFT in a time–stopping " "show at the Main Stage. The other three stages are housing artists like Chris Liebing, Loco " "Dice and Faithless (DJ SET).

"
"On Friday night BLOC PARTY takes over the Main Stage alongside WHITE LIES and MYSTERY JETS. " "Orbital, Rudimental (DJ SET), Alex Metric and Hot Chip ((DJ SET) are some of the artists " "announced for the eclectic remaining stages.

"
"DAVID GUETTA brings his A–game in a revolutionary light & visuals show on Saturday night. " "Robin Schulz, Jonas Blue, Dubfire and Markus Schulz are confirmed to play the festival as well.

"
"On the last day of TIMESHIFT, the Main Stage is enriched by ABOVE & BEYOND. Catch also " "Goldie and Chicane on Sunday. From EDM, techno, tech–house, trance, indie–rock and " "alternative, music–lovers and festival–goers will find the perfect setup for the ultimate " "DJs and bands that will perform in Bucharest.

"

"The sixth edition of the Bucharest Jazz Festival will take place between July 3 and 9, 2017. " "The festival will feature five live concerts, held between 5 and 9 July in George Enescu " "Square, and related events between 3 and 9 July, at ARCUB. The entry is free.

"
"Bucharest Jazz Festival continues this year's tradition of events that put jazz in the heart " "of Bucharest's cultural preoccupations.

"
"The festival launches a new program for the promotion of young jazz performers called New " "Jazz Voices. The contest is part of the New Jazz Works program, launched in 2015 at the " "suggestion of curator Lucian Ban and coming in 2017 to support the Romanian jazz vocalists, " "at the proposal of the artist and current curator, Teodora Enache. The New Jazz Voices " "enrollment call is open until June 14, 2017, including the winning artist's chance to " "perform on the Bucharest Jazz Festival stage in the 2018 edition. Details about the " "participation can be found on the festival's website: www.bucharestjazzfestival.ro. " "Another novelty is the introduction in the festival program of the series of live sessions " "and jazz improvisations to be held at ARCUB after the concerts in George Enescu Square. " "Every night, part of the finalists of the New Jazz Voices competition will hold a live " "session alongside the band led by Cătălin Milea.

"
"Soon the artists will be announced to climb the festival stage.

"

"On June 29 at 20:00, EVANESCENCE will play in Bucharest at the Romanian Arenas. Tickets at " "special prices are already on sale at www.iabilet.ro and in the network iabilet.ro/retea. " "Evanescence, one of America's most beloved and appreciated rock bands, is once again in a " "magical formula where the voice of famous singer Amy Lee ennobles the songs that have " "consecrated the band and which have remained immortal on the lips of fans around the world. " "With albums sold in tens of millions of copies around the world, Evanescence has been " "rewarded with numerous international nominations and awards, including two Grammy's received " "in 2004 for "Bring Me To Life", "Best New Artist" and "Best Hard Rock Performance".

"
"The album "Fallen" is still the top of the preferences of those who love rock music, " "Platinum certified worldwide. "Fallen" is one of eight albums of all time that have managed " "to stay on the top Billboad 200 for more than a year. "The Open Door" (2006) marked a new " "success in the record of the famous group, with songs such as "Lithium" or "Sweet Sacrifice", " "and "Evanescence" (2011) reached the top spot immediately after launching and was awarded " "Gold in Australia, Canada and the UK.

"
"Evanescence's music carries a full range of influences and has been featured by critics in " "various categories, from rock, not metal and gothic to industrial, progressive or hard rock. " "With sophisticated valences and great attention to detail, Evanescence has been able to offer " "audiences fascinating pieces that have already passed the proof of time.

"
"Along with Evanescence, you will have the chance to see three super bands whose compositions " "have crossed the borders of the countries they come from: Killa (IT), Sede Vacante (GR) and " "Fall Has Come (IT).

"

"The fourth edition of the Shine Festival will be held from 30 June to 1 July 2017 at " "the Romanian Arenas.

"
"After winning the Best Alternative Festival at Metalhead Awards in 2015, and enjoying the " "presence of more than 8,000 viewers in 2016, under the aegis of "Come & Shine", Shine wishes " "to maintain its position in the leaders of the Capital festivals and thank the fans for the " "vote of confidence and promises them that they will not deceive their expectations even " "in 2017.

"
"Canadians from Three Days Grace arrive for the first time in Romania as headliners of the " "Shine Festival, the fourth edition, which will take place on June 30 and July 1 at the " "Romanian Arenas in Bucharest. The festival changed its date (initially it took place on July " "1 and 2) just to make room for such a big name on its stage! Also, Subcarpati come for the " "second consecutive year to rumble the Romanian Arenas, playing officially with Coma and " "Alternosfera, ambassadors of the festival.

"
"In addition to the above–mentioned troops, the Vita de Vie will also be on the stage of " "the festival, Şuie Paparude, E.M.I.L. And the Luna Amara. The newest confirmed bands, which " "also close the festival poster, are: Am fost la munte și Mi–a Plăcut, Jinxy Von D'ers, " "Umbra, Next Ex, Arthur and Mouse N Monkeyz.

"

"Mogoșoaia Palace is situated about 10 kilometres from Bucharest, Romania. It was built " "between 1698–1702 by Constantin Brâncoveanu in what is called the Romanian Renaissance " "style or Brâncovenesc style. The palace bears the name of the widow of the Romanian boyar " "Mogoș, who owned the land it was built on.\n\n"

"The National Museum of the Romanian Peasant is a museum in Bucharest, Romania, with a " "collection of textiles (especially costumes), icons, ceramics, and other artifacts of " "Romanian peasant life. One of Europe\'s leading museums of popular arts and traditions, " "it was designated "European Museum of the Year" for 1996. Its collection includes over " "100,000 objects.\n\n"

"The Romanian Athenaeum is a concert hall in the center of Bucharest, Romania and a landmark " "of the Romanian capital city. Opened in 1888, the ornate, domed, circular building is " "the city\'s main concert hall and home of the \"George Enescu\" Philharmonic and of the " "George Enescu annual international music festival.\n\n"

"The CEC Palace in Bucharest, Romania, built in 1900 and situated on Calea Victoriei opposite " "the National Museum of Romanian History, is the headquarter of CEC Bank.

"
"Before the construction of the palace, the location was occupied by the ruins of a monastery " "(Saint John the Great) and an adjoining inn. The 16th–century church was renovated by " "Constantin Brâncoveanu during 1702–1703, but later deteriorated and was demolished in 1875.

"
"The palace was built as a new headquarters for Romania's oldest bank, the public savings " "institution Casa de Depuneri, Consemnațiuni și Economie, later known as C.E.C., and nowadays " "CEC Bank. The land was bought and the building constructed with the institution's own funds. " "Work started on June 8, 1897 and was completed in 1900. The project was designed by the " "architect Paul Gottereau, a graduate of the École nationale supérieure des Beaux–Arts in " "Paris; construction was supervised by the Romanian architect Ion Socolescu.

"

"AFI Palace Cotroceni is a shopping mall in Bucharest, Romania. It is located in the " "central–western part of the city, between the city center and two of the largest " "residential districts, Militari and Drumul Taberei.

"
"The mall has 300 stores, 1 IMAX (3–D Cinema), 20 screen cinema complex, 30 fast–food and " "restaurants, 1 hypermarket Auchan, kids playground, ice ring, climbing wall, water features, " "games & entertainment, fashion and 2,500 underground & deck parking spaces.

"

"Băneasa Shopping City is a shopping center in northern Bucharest, opened on April 18, 2008. " "It has a total leasable area of ​​85,000 square meters and is owned by businessman Gabriel " "Popoviciu. The builder of the mall was the French company Bouygues. The investment in the " "development of the mall was 150 million euros. Baneasa Shopping City is the fifth mall " "opened in Bucharest after Bucharest Mall and Plaza Romania, City Mall and Unirea Shopping " "Center. It has a total of 200 stores. The shopping center attracted over 750,000 visitors " "in the first month.

"
"Baneasa Shopping City is part of the Baneasa Project, controlled by businessmen Gabriel " "Popoviciu and Radu Dimofte, alongside the University of Agricultural Sciences and Veterinary " "Medicine Bucharest (USAMVB). The investment in the whole project is estimated at 1.8 " "billion euros. The Băneasa commercial park (also called Băneasa Commercial Zone), which " "includes the Băneasa Shopping City shopping mall, the Feeria shopping center, as well as " "distinct units of retailers such as IKEA, Carrefour, Bricostore or Mobexpert, is the " "largest development of its kind in Romania. Has involved total investments estimated at " "around 300 million euros so far. The Baneasa Commercial Zone is one of the three integrated " "parts of the Baneasa Project. In addition to the 450,000 square meter shopping area, the " "Baneasa Project will provide over 3,000 dwelling units and a business park with A and A plus " "office space of 160,000 square meters.

"

"Plaza Romania is a shopping center in Bucharest, inaugurated on October 28, 2004. It has " "a leasable area of 41,000 square meters, and houses over 150 shops and cinemas in " "total. It is located at the intersection of Timisoara Boulevard with The Lujer Passage, " "between Drumul Taberei and Militari districts. It was inaugurated after one total " "investment of 45 million euros.

" "It is owned by Turkey's Anchor Group, which also owns the shopping center " "Bucharest Mall. Anchor Group is part of the Turkish FIBA group and is one of the first " "Foreign investors who entered the local real estate market in 1997.

"

"Promenada Mall Bucharest is a shopping center in Romania. It was developed by the Raiffeisen " "Evolution Investment Fund and was inaugurated on October 17, 2013, after an investment of " "130 million euros. Promenada is the first mall in Bucharest opened after the financial " "crisis of 2007–2009, the construction started on January 2012 and lasted 22 months.

"
"Flanco, Billa, Zara, H & M, C & A and Peek & Cloppenburg are present in the " "shopping center.

"
"Promenada Mall, Bucharest won the first prize in the "Mixed Solutions" category at the " "First Rigips Trophy Romania Prize.

"
"In November 2013, the shopping center was bought by the NEPI investment fund.

"
